intro: Eriostemon brucei subsp. cinereus, commonly known as the grey-flowered eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greyish-green leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in heathlands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
